Systems Biology Workbench (SBW)

edu.caltech.sbw
Class Config

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.caltech.sbw.Config
public final class Config
extends Object

This class manages various SBW configuration variables and related information. This includes such things as the SBW Broker port number, the OS currently in use, the SBW version number, etc.

Version:
$Revision: 1.2 $
Author:
Michael Hucka, $Author: mhucka $

Method Detail

getSBWVersion

public static final String getSBWVersion()
Returns the overall version number of the SBW Java interface library. This version number is maintained manually and is independent of the revision control numbers assigned (currently using CVS) to individual files in the SBW library. The string returned by this method has the form "major.minor.build", where the major and minor versions are obtained from the constant ConfigVars.SBW_VERSION and the build number is obtained from the constant ConfigVars.SBW_BUILD.

A typical use of version strings by a program is to adapt its behavior based on knowledge of features implemented in different versions of SBW. Although the dotted format of the version string does not lend itself to direct parsing as either an integer or a floating-point quantity, a program should be able to parse the string easily enough using a combination of the substring extraction methods of String and Integer.parseInt(String s).

Returns:
a string indicating the version number of this copy of SBW

printConfigVars

public static final void printConfigVars()
This simply prints the values of SBW configuration variables to the Java standard output stream. This is usually only used for debugging purposes.

printSystemInfo

public static final void printSystemInfo()
This method prints the values of a variety of Java system properties to the Java standard output stream. This is usually only used for debugging purposes.

getSBWHome

public static final File getSBWHome()
Returns the value of the directory where SBW is installed on this computer.

Returns:
the value of SBW_HOME as a directory

getCoreJarFile

public static final String getCoreJarFile()
Returns the name of the SBWCore JAR file. This is adjustable at run-time using the property "sbw.core.jarfile", and defaults to the value set by DEFAULT_CORE_JARFILE.

Returns:
a string naming the SBW core Jar file

getBrokerJarFiles

public static final String[] getBrokerJarFiles()
Returns the names of the JAR files needed by the SBW Broker. The format of the string returned is a semicolon-separated list of file names. The value is adjustable at run-time using the property "sbw.broker.jarfiles", and defaults to the value set by DEFAULT_CORE_JARFILE.

Returns:
a string listing the JAR files needed by the SBW Broker

getSBWClassPath

public static final File getSBWClassPath()
Returns the directory in which the SBW core JAR file is located, to be used as the path to the SBW class files. The search algorithm looks in the following directories in turn and returns the first directory in which the file indicated by getCoreJarFile() is found:
  1. All directories listed in the Java CLASSPATH variable
  2. The SBW home directory, given by property "sbw.home"
  3. The directory given by the property "user.dir"
  4. A built-in hardwired default directory (the value returned by getDefaultSBWHome().

Returns:
a File object representing the directory, or null

getBrokerRegistryFile

public static final File getBrokerRegistryFile()
Returns the Broker registry file.

Returns:
the Broker registry file.

getBrokerPort

public static final int getBrokerPort()
Returns the socket port number for the SBW Broker.

Returns:
the Broker port number

getBrokerStartupWait

public static final int getBrokerStartupWait()
Returns the time (in tenths of seconds) to wait for the Broker to start up, in case the Broker is not already started up when a module is first run.

Returns:
the time to wait, in tenths of seconds

getModuleStartupWait

public static final int getModuleStartupWait()
Returns the number of tenths of seconds to wait for a module to start up when a module must be started by the Broker.

Returns:
the time to wait, in tenths of seconds

getBrokerOptions

public static final String getBrokerOptions()
Returns a string containing an optional set of command-line options to be passed to the SBW Broker when it is started up. The value of this is set by the property "sbw.broker.options".

Returns:
the command-line options to pass to the Broker

getModuleOptions

public static final String getModuleOptions()
Returns a string containing an optional set of command-line options to be passed to every module when it is started up. The value of this is set by the property "sbw.module.options".

Returns:
the command-line options to pass

getStackDepthOffset

public static final int getStackDepthOffset()
Returns an offset to correct for bizarro difference in the stacktraces printed by the logging code. This is set by the property "sbw.stack.depth.offset".

Explanation: For some reason, the depth differs when SBW is run from within IBM's version of Java compared to when it's run from other JREs. The stack tracing code is used in more places than just the logging package, so this turns out to be a fairly important parameter to set correctly. Basically, if you have tracing turned on and the trace messages refer to SBWLog.trace() rather than to the SBW method that invoked SBWLog.trace(), then this variable needs to be adjusted. Usually the value needs to be adjusted by 1, and whether it is up or down depends on the JRE being used.

Returns:
an integer, the depth offset in effect.

getBrokerConnectionsAccept

public static final String getBrokerConnectionsAccept()
Returns a string representing an IP address pattern for client addresses that are permitted to connect to the SBW Broker. The pattern can contain '*' as a wildcard character, e.g., "192.168.*.*".

The SBW Broker uses the following sequential procedure for determine whether a client can connect:

  • If the IP address matches the pattern given by "sbw.broker.connections.deny", the connection is refused.
  • If the IP address matches the pattern given by "sbw.broker.connections.accept", the connection is accepted.
  • If the address matches neither pattern, the connection is refused.
The default configuration for the SBW Broker, in the absence of any settings of either "sbw.broker.connections.deny" or "sbw.broker.connections.accept", is to accept connections only from the local host.

Returns:
the IP pattern

getBrokerConnectionsDeny

public static final String getBrokerConnectionsDeny()
Returns a string representing an IP address pattern for client addresses that are denied from connecting to the SBW Broker. The pattern can contain '*' as a wildcard character, e.g., "192.168.*.*".

The SBW Broker uses the following sequential procedure for determine whether a client can connect:

  • If the IP address matches the pattern given by "sbw.broker.connections.deny", the connection is refused.
  • If the IP address matches the pattern given by "sbw.broker.connections.accept", the connection is accepted.
  • If the address matches neither pattern, the connection is refused.
The default configuration for the SBW Broker, in the absence of any settings of either "sbw.broker.connections.deny" or "sbw.broker.connections.accept", is to accept connections only from the local host.

Returns:
the IP pattern

recordClassVersion

public static final void recordClassVersion(Class theClass,
                                            String cvsInfo)
Record the version of an SBW class for configuration management purposes. The basic idea is that each class in SBW uses the following code to record version info: 
 static {
     Config.recordClassVersion(Foo.class, "$Id$");
 }
This has the effect that when the class is loaded, the CVS version information is stored internally. The identity of every SBW class loaded in a running session is therefore recorded exactly, which permits dumping class version info at run-time. This may be useful for debugging problems in the deployed system.

Parameters:
c - the class for which information is being recorded.
cvsInfo - the version info string, usually "$Id$".

classes

public static final Iterator classes()
Returns an Iterator() object that can be used to walk down the objects in the table of class version info in SBW.

Returns:
an Iterator object
See Also:
recordClassVersion(Class c, String cvsInfo)

classInfo

public static final String classInfo(Class theClass)
Given an SBW class, this returns the version information string maintained by Config().

Parameters:
c - the class for which version info should be returned.
See Also:
recordClassVersion(Class c, String cvsInfo)

printClassVersions

public static final void printClassVersions()
Print the names of all SBW classes and their version info strings. Output goes to System.out.

See Also:
recordClassVersion(Class c, String cvsInfo)

getDefaultSBWHome

public static final File getDefaultSBWHome()
Returns the internal hardwired default pathname for the SBW installation directory. This is an OS-dependent value, and is only used as a last-ditch effort when other directories have failed.

Returns:
a File object representing the SBW library directory (if running on an OS supported by the current version of SBW), or null (if running on an unsupported OS).
